comments:
I20050330-0500

This is maybe a problem in the commands plugin - if so, please move the bug up.

- Have compilation unit p/A.java:
-----------------------
package p;
public class B { }
-----------------------

- Change "B" to "A"
- Edit > Undo Typing
- Ctrl+1, choose "Rename compilation unit to 'B.java'"

=> The following exception is written to the console (but not to the log):

I rearranged our code which prevents this bug from occurring again but basically
the operation history shouldn't query commands that I am just asking to dispose
from the history.

FYI: my fix will be in one of the next I-builds for M6

During the flush, remove notifications are sent to listeners.
What's happening here is that the redo action handler is checking its 
enablement as a result of the flush of the undo stack.  The redo TextCommand 
has not been disposed yet, so I think it's fair that this is happening 
(although wasteful given the redo stack is about to be flushed next).  So I 
don't see that this a bug in the operation history.  History notifications are 
sent for changes to the history and the listener in this case was fairly 
querying an object that had not (quite) yet been disposed.

Feel free to dispose. We are safe on our side. Just let's hope no other client
runs into this ;-)

This does point out that the javadoc for event notifications should be improved 
so that clients do know that once a REMOVED notification is received, the 
operation is disposed.  Keeping this bug open as a reminder.

(Note that the problem in the original description was not that the REMOVED op 
was being accessed...just that a different op - the one in the redo stack - was 
being accessed while the operations were being flushed.)

should also update the dispose javadoc to explain that notifications will still 
occur during this time.

Updated javadoc for OperationHistoryEvent.REMOVED notification and 
IOperationHistory.dispose.  

Released > 20050405
Verified in I20050509-2010 by code inspection.
